events.title: Founding of the University of Groningen
events.description: The University of Groningen was established in the Netherlands, becoming one of the oldest and most prestigious universities in Europe.
events.significance: It became a major center for scientific research and education influencing European higher education.

events.title: Discovery of Easter Island
events.description: Dutch explorer Jacob Roggeveen discovered Easter Island during a Pacific expedition on Easter Sunday.
events.significance: Introduction of Easter Island to the Western world and significant in studies of Polynesian culture.

events.title: First World Cup Football Match
events.description: The first ever FIFA World Cup match was played in Montevideo, Uruguay, between Uruguay and Peru.
events.significance: Beginning of the world's largest international football tournament.

events.title: Death of Mao Zedong
events.description: Mao Zedong, founding father of the People's Republic of China and influential communist leader, died at age 82.
events.significance: His death marked the end of an era and led to significant political reforms in China.

events.title: Start of the Rwandan Genocide
events.description: Following the assassination of Rwandan President Juv√©nal Habyarimana, mass killings of Tutsi and moderate Hutu began.
events.significance: One of the most tragic genocides in history with profound humanitarian and political consequences.
